website_summaries.verdict: A good quality spoon that's a top option for older babies.
pros: Customers note the durability, well-made design, and value of these spoons
The chunky design gets top points for being easy for little hands to hold
We also love that there's a bottom support so the spoon can get set down without making a mess
cons: A few felt the spoon design was too large and shallow

customer_reviews.title: The spoon part is FLAT
customer_reviews.text: I love the matching forks for these, so I figured I would buy the spoons too. I hate them. The spoon part is almost completely flat. It's annoying enough for me to spoon feed my toddler, but he reallllllly wants to do it himself and is not able to keep even the tiniest bit in this spoon from table to mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Nice deep spoons!
customer_reviews.text: We tried a few spoons and these are great for our 18 month old! For some reason when I ordered the spoons as a "3 pack" I was sent three separate three packs of 3...was only charged the normal $4 so I'm not complaining just noting for others. We also have the forks and those came in a 3pk too - 3 forks in one package, just as expected. Very easy for my toddler to hold and manipulate and I like that you get three (kitchen, diaper bag, spare). The spoons have deep enough bowls that you can hold a good amount (some spoons very much fail here).
customer_reviews.author: silverluna78

customer_reviews.title: Skip these spoons too flat and wide
customer_reviews.text: We have the forks and knives and they are great. The spoons are terrible. They are too flat to be truly functional and also too wide. The width my son could grow to use it but being flat it just defeats the purpose. We will stick with the baby spoons until we can find a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect spoon for toddler
customer_reviews.text: I love the size and it's ability to hold the perfect serving for my picky toddler. The spoons I had before were from his baby stage but at 16 months u knew we had to step up the game, went in search and this based on recommendations I selected. And I'm pleased. Also, my son is able to grasp it comfortably well between his little fingers as he tries to feed self. Dislike- it holds food stain on rubber on the back, that protruded part that rests on surface. Doesn't matter what I use, it just won't return to the original color. Apart from that, I would recommend without reservations.
customer_reviews.author: NadiaF

customer_reviews.title: These are the perfect size for my kiddo to learn to self feed ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect size for my kiddo to learn to self feed with utensils. They have an easy-grip handle and a short handle, to make it easier to navigate to his mouth. The silverware portion is real metal which is more fun for him (feels like a big boy when he uses them) and is better training for eventual regular silverware. We have used them for 6 months now with MANY uses and many times in the dishwasher and they are still in great condition, so they are very well made. Very happy with these utensils!
customer_reviews.author: JasonTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Old Gerber vs new first essentials
customer_reviews.text: I had a set of old gerber spoons (pink) and the new first essentials (green) are different. They are flat and sit lower to the surface as you can see in the pictures. I was going to return them but then after trying them i found out they are as good as the old ones they hold the same amount food and kids don't have a problem using either
customer_reviews.author: Lara M.

customer_reviews.title: great spoon for babies/toddlers learning how to feed themselves.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have bought these spoons (one time was in a box store, second time on Amazon). They are perfect for older babies and toddlers as they learn to feed themselves. Our almost 3 year old still uses these for things like yogurt, ice cream, things that we really don't want her having giant spoonfulls at a time. They are not great for something like soup (it would take her hours to finish a bowl of soup) but are still useful! We are having baby #2 in October so I expect we will be purchasing more eventually as these get lost/worn out!
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Shallow Spoon
customer_reviews.text: The handle and size are great, pulse it has a built in rest so that it won't roll around. However, the stars are lost in the fact that the actual spoon part is so flat that it makes it hard to scoop up anything. My son mixes his potatoes and peas which fall right off the spoon, his has actually confused him enough that at times he starts using it as a fork and stabs at his food. If you are feeding your child these are great but so a little one learning to use utensils the spoon makes it a struggle.
customer_reviews.author: PrincessKateTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Best toddler spoon ever
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several brands of toddler spoons and this is the best by far. It's like a toddler version of the metal adult spoons in your home!! I don't have to worry about the plastic being worn after a while or my son's teeth scraping through the plastic when he bits down and possibly digesting some. It's wide enough to hold more food than the standard spoon and not to deep as to where the child can't get the food off easily in their mouths. I highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Neska R.

customer_reviews.title: Best toddler utensils
customer_reviews.text: Not much to even say except that these utensils are great. They hold up well, they're easy for toddlers to grip, and they're easy to clean. We've used ours for four years now, between two kids, and have never had any complaints. It's a little tricky to get a daycare label onto them, so I usually just use a sharpie to put my kids' initials on the handle. It does eventually wash off, but it's not something I lose sleep over.
customer_reviews.author: MW401

customer_reviews.title: Our daily go-to for 2 year old.
customer_reviews.text: We had several pairs of forks and spoons from various manufacturers. These are the only ones we use! They are PERFECT for little hands, easy to grip and learn with. Not too long or skinny. The spoons hold just the right amount of food, and the forks actually work (hooray!) but aren't so pointy that they can injure the typical toddler. With these, our little one really gained confidence and matured her use of utensils.
customer_reviews.author: LYNZ

customer_reviews.title: Kid tested. Mom approved.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about these kid's silverware, so much so that I tossed all of our old ones and replaced them with several sets of these. I have 3 small kids (ages 5,4, and 2) and they're rough...on everything. Their old silverware was falling apart and decided to replace them with something a bit more durable. These have held up great so far. They're easy to hold and have been thoroughly kid tested. They've gone through the dishwasher, been left outside, stepped on, used as shovels in the dirt, and survived being lost in the couch of horrors. Oh, and the green is a nice color. So there's that.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Too large for my 16 month old
customer_reviews.text: These are way too big for my 16 month old, so I've been using them for my older kids (ages 4 and 7). We didn't need any more junior sized spoons, though. We needed baby spoons that have the rounded handle because the baby is just learning to feed herself and this does not fit into her mouth. They do seem to be good quality, so we kept them.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: I think these spoons are a great tool for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I think these spoons are a great tool for toddlers. It's hard to imagine a better toddler spoon. They are very sturdy, the right size in both lenght/handle and spoon diameter/depth, easy to clean and keep clean, and the kids love them. We started our kids on them a little after 12-15 months and at 3.5 its still a great size and in great shape. The matching forks are also fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Czop

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: The problem I have with these spoons is that they are really wide and flat. They are not convenient for my 2 year old to use because whatever she is trying to eat will slide right off the flat surface. It's like if I tried to eat with a small spatula. So everything advertised is true, but they do not work well for my child and she prefers the tiny, cheap, plastic ones we originally bought.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Fleischhauer

customer_reviews.title: Great for little hands
customer_reviews.text: 15 month old is trying to learn to use tableware- perfect size for little hands. Out of all the spoons and forks I’ve been buying he is able to use these the best-due to them being small and fat, he holds them better than the skinnier spoons I have found. I highly recommend for the toddler.
customer_reviews.author: carla

customer_reviews.title: There's very little dip in the middle to hold liquids like watery soup broths
customer_reviews.text: The spoon part on these is much larger than I expected. It's also relatively "flat" making more mess than a traditional spoon with my kids. I'd almost call it a rounded fork without prongs with how it's shaped. Using it to feed our 1 year old, he often pushed the food over the back and up the handle rather than getting it into his mouth. Even our preschooler was guilty of that a few times. There's very little dip in the middle to hold liquids like watery soup broths, so anything that's watery will be extremely messy. For things with a more pudding or oatmeal consistency, they're great. But it also depends on how sloppy your kids are.
customer_reviews.author: Fae

customer_reviews.title: Very useful for self feeding babies
customer_reviews.text: I started using this after my daughter’s first birthday. It took a while for my daughter to get used to this while she strated to self feed. Niw she is 18months old and she always used this spoon while eating. A very good spoon,easy to clean and easy for grip.
customer_reviews.author: alokananda k.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect price for a set of spoons your kids will love
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these spoons... and so other kids at school who accidentally get sent home with them! 😛 The price is right for this type of product and is a perfect in between for them before and after they develop their pincer grasp.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good spoons
customer_reviews.text: They're perfect. I needed a few spares for my toddler. They tend to disappear constantly, so this was exactly what I was looking for. They hold up fine in the dishwasher, and my toddler doesn't have any issues using them.
customer_reviews.author: Joel & Amber

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the "grown-up" baby
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are great. They are easy for my almost 2 year to hold and feed herself with. She will actually use these vs any other baby utensils because most baby spoons are plastic and these are more like adult utensils. She's not big enough for adult utensils but refuses to use anything else because she's a big girl now and everyone even brother uses adult utensils. These are perfect for her little mouth. When she's in a cranky mood at mealtimes she turns it sideways and teethes on the grip. It's soft enough that I don't worry about her teeth or her ripping it apart. That's more a perk though.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, high quality
customer_reviews.text: My kids (3.5 and 1.5 years old) love these. Only negatives I can say are that they are a little bit shallow so when scooping items that don't stick well to the spoon (i.e. peas) they can fall off for the less experienced spoon user (i.e. the 18 month old) and there is a small feature that requires a little more attention to clean (but these are dishwasher safe and hold up well, so not a huge issue). Overall, we love these spoons!
customer_reviews.author: Beth C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little hands!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for little hands! Our other baby utensils were too skinny and long for our little guy. These are perfect length and thickness. Our one year old can easily handle them! Love that they can go in the dish washer.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment. Good design idea but bad application and sizing
customer_reviews.text: The mouth piece on these spoons are huge, even larger & wider than some of the spoons I use as a full grown adult. Plus, they are said to balance so that the mouth piece doesn't rest on surfaces, preventing contact with bacteria that may rest on kitchen and other surfaces. Untrue. With or without food on the spoon the balance is off and the design does not allow for it to do its intended purpose or function as advertised. I think my little one will be using these as toys rather than eating utensils. They'll be good for banging on pot sand pans.
customer_reviews.author: mamamojo

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Perfect spoon
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a great spoon for my 12 month old son. It’s a little wider than most spoons so it holds a little more which I like. And I also feel like this will be a great spoon for him to start self feeding.
customer_reviews.author: Ileana

customer_reviews.title: Great for my toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: I like these because they're sturdier than plastic, and my kids like them because they feel a little more grown up when they use them. We have the forks, too. kids use them more than any other silverware they own
customer_reviews.author: meagan

customer_reviews.title: The only spoons you’ll need for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are the best. They’re the only spoons you’ll need once you’re baby transitions into toddlerhood. We’re on our third kid and have tried them all and now all we have is a pack of these and it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Great BLW spoon!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these with all my kids. I do babyled weaning so no purreed foods. These spoons are easy for baby's to manage while also self feeding! You can also use them for other kids too.
customer_reviews.author: abbyk

customer_reviews.title: Very Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I like the overall size of these but the dip in the spoon is almost non-existent. The shallow dip is fine for a toddler who has mastered eating with a spoon but otherwise food just slides right off for the less skilled. I purchased these because they were size appropriate but I'll be looking into other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a little wide for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 types of spoons and these are my least favorite. They handles are great for my daughter to grip and I love the matching forks, but the actual metal spoon part is a tiny bit too wide, at least for my 12-18 month old (the time span she has been using these). She can fully feed herself, without spilling, with other types of spoons, but with these, she usually ends up dumping a little over the side as she tries to cram this spoon into her mouth. I think she will be grow into these, but for now, they are just too wide.
customer_reviews.author: Luci

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: we’ve had this same brand of flatware for my daughter and needed more after having more kids. My oldest set are 4 years old and still going strong after many drops, hand washes, dishwashers, throws, and anything else toddlers can to do abuse them. Handles are comfortable for them and the part that goes in their mouths aren’t too big or too small (about age 18 mo and up is how I used them). Wonderful quality for the price
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 & 4 year old grandchildren who are too old for the baby cutlery but struggle with adult size silverware. These are perfect. They are easy for them to maneuver, which results in less mess. I'm very pleased with this purchase. They are also made well and seem to be very durable. I do wish they came in more of a variety of colors but that's just a personal wish. I would definitely purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Dancynfairy

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: Love these from learning to grasp to Beyond tollderhood. They also have the little Divet so they don’t have to touch the table and one prong is longer so when they learn how to use a knife they can put it in between The forks.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great size for small-medium children!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great size for pre-school aged children, not too small for babies, and not a full-sized adult spoon. I am comfortable letting my 12-month-old daughter use these while she is learning also. These seem a little bigger than most toddler spoons that I find in stores., but they are more flat than a plastic to-go spoon so less spillage or overloading will happen.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica W.

customer_reviews.title: Dots
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews that the dots come off but I have had the forks for 2 years and wash them on the top shelf of the dishwasher all the time. I haven't had any problems with them so I got these matching spoons that seem to be the same quality. I'm still keeping my eye on those dots, but I'd be surprised if they really fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: aLl good. Byte size is small
customer_reviews.text: This is very good for toddlers - I only wish it had a slightly larger byte size. Right now, hardly 3-4 cheerios fit in. There is a better way to do this - the spoon should have a little more 'depth'
customer_reviews.author: Anu

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Great, dishwasher safe spoons for toddlers. The feature to keep the spoon itself off the tabletop doesn't work in real life - what toddler is coordinated enough to set the spoon down the exact right way every time? That wasn't the reason I bought them, so not a disappointment - they're easy for her to hold, a good size (standard toddler spoon size), cute, and were a good price. Got the matching forks as well.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Very shallow and wide for the baby.
customer_reviews.text: After using them for a while I’m not sure I like them. They are too wide for my baby and when I feed her the food spills from the sides coz the spoon won’t fit in her mouth . The spoon is very shallow so these are useless with liquid like soups or broths. I really wish they’d be little narrow and deep so babies can eat without spilling or not fitting into their tiny mouths.
customer_reviews.author: Jalpa

customer_reviews.title: It's a flat spoon. You can't scoop anything!
customer_reviews.text: The spoon is sturdy but my goodness there is no slope to it. My toddler is 21 months and is great at feeding herself but she can't scoop much of anything on it cause it's almost flat. It's also a bit too wide for a toddlers mouth. Great look and sturdy but useless in design. So disappointed I should have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Davis

customer_reviews.title: Not sized right for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: No way these spoons are usable unless you have the mouth of a giant! They don't slope into a spoon shape to hold anything and are super wide and would hurt a kids mouth. I loved their forks and thought these would be great too but big NO
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Good Spoons
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 18 month old and he loves using these spoons. They hold a lot more than the other spoons he had been using. I do think sometimes that they are a little too big since they can hold so much, but the trade off is that a decent amount actually makes it to his mouth because the spoon is so large. We're still in the transition phase from the really small toddler spoon to these spoons, but my son is really starting to get the hang of using these spoons. Overall I am happy with these spoons and I think they will work well at helping him to eventually transition to adult spoons.
customer_reviews.author: RiverSong

customer_reviews.title: Great spoons for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: We use these for my daughter and they’re perfect. I like that the spoon part is metal not plastic. The handle is easy for her to grip and I love the way it’s shaped so that when she puts it down on the table the part that goes in her mouth doesn’t hit the table.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Functional, and nice colors!
customer_reviews.text: I love these spoons for my toddler. Their length and thickness of handle is perfect for her to easily bring to her mouth in the awkward learning stage she is in. The spoon end is also big enough to hold a decent mouthful of food for her (she has a big mouth). I like the fact that the spoon is metal as well because the edge is thinner than the silicone spoons and she can scoop more easily. Good all around.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Canary

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small hands!
customer_reviews.text: Great ergonomic design. My toddler loves these forks and spoons. He uses them every day, multiple times a day. They have gone through the dishwasher countless times and still look brand new. They have a rubber grip, so his hand does not slip. They are smaller than typical forks and spoons - the perfect size for small hands. They are also colorful and pleasing to toddlers! The metal fork and spoon ends show no signs of rust even after 2 years of constant use. These are a great investment and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to hold and clean
customer_reviews.text: Favorite spoon /fork type. Easy to hold, good angle to get food in. Spoons aren't so deep that your doesn't come off easily and not breakable.
customer_reviews.author: loafer4christ

customer_reviews.title: Great spoons for older babies/toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My 21 month old son has been using these spoons for 6 - 9 months (can't remember exactly), and they are great. The handle is thick enough for him to really hang on with his hand, and the spoon is large enough to hold a good amount of whatever food he's eating. We hand wash or put them in the utensil bin in the dishwasher, and they've held up great. We also have the fork set, and those are fantastic, too. Really nice set for those early years when they're really working on feeding themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Laura F

customer_reviews.title: ... rating but over time I discovered these cute and comfortable looking go to silverware is no great for toddlers ...
customer_reviews.text: Originally I would have given this a 5 start rating but over time I discovered these cute and comfortable looking go to silverware is no great for toddlers or chewers. My daughter got to the point where pieces were falling off from it being in her mouth or she was swallowing or slightly choking on them. Otherwise great for little hands, cute looking with a variety of colors, and a comfortable handle.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our toddler
customer_reviews.text: Our toddler loves these spoons, especially compared to some of the "baby" plastic spoons. The wide handle is easy for him to hold, and the shallow scoop makes it easier for him to eat from.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Corinne - Bethesda Maternity and Newborn Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Great first spoon as an occupational therapist i can honestly say this spoon is optimal for encouraging independent feeding/spoon use.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy_Shopper

customer_reviews.title: The Chosen Spoon
customer_reviews.text: Of all the baby spoons out there (and there seem to be a lot), these are the ones my kids like the most. I think it's the heavy weight and the thick handle that they enjoy. I'm not sure. But 3 out of 3 kids in our house have chosen these spoons over the other brands once they're able to feed themselves with spoons. They're a little too big for the baby food phase but still smaller than regular cutlery so we have several sets in the house for smaller hands.
customer_reviews.author: SelinaB5

customer_reviews.title: Good Spoons for a Range of Ages
customer_reviews.text: My son is almost 3 and we've been using this since about 8 months old. Very durable, good grip, easy for him to feed himself.
customer_reviews.author: Angel D

customer_reviews.title: Too flat
customer_reviews.text: Good size, but it’s very flat. It’s not good for cereal or other foods with liquid, but is fine for thicker foods like yogurt or oatmeal.
customer_reviews.author: Amber H

customer_reviews.title: Great spoons!
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are great, though I have to admit I bought them in a rush and expected a spoon, knife and fork. Nope, three spoons! Just as well, these spoons are great and now we have extras. I had previously used a cute spoon with a cute illustration on it, but it got milk up inside the handle part and started to smell funky. There is no risk of that with these.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: Love these for our 21 month old girl. She easily is able to hold onto and use these spoons. I love that the spoon part is metal as any adult spoon would be. Its apparent as you hold them that they are made with high quality in mind but at the same time fun for toddlers to use. We have washed them numerous times in our dishwasher on high temps with no wear & tear issues.
customer_reviews.author: edziu76

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: These are very flat, definitely not a cereal eating kind of spoon. More for very solid types of foods. Overall good for the price you pay.
customer_reviews.author: EllaPags

customer_reviews.title: Great training spoons
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are perfect for my one year old. They are pretty flat which helps him get the food off of the spoon easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Great spoon.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hold. The ladle itself is a little large so if I had to complain I would say this feeding size is more suitable for a toddler or preschooler. But they can grow with your child.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Rubalcaba

customer_reviews.title: Huge heads
customer_reviews.text: These spoon heads are huge. Like the size of a normal adult spoon. I ordered them hoping to let my 1 year old use these, but way too big. Maybe they would work for older toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly456

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for toddler
customer_reviews.text: We love these for our toddler! I love the weight of the handle and the ease of use. We’ve gone thru many utensils trying to find one that works best for her and this is it!
customer_reviews.author: kristin j jamieson

customer_reviews.title: It’s not plastic it’s silicon and stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: Very easy for 2 years old kid to hold and eat. Messy in the beginning but they learn like that though.
customer_reviews.author: Devi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toddler spoons
customer_reviews.text: My go-to toddler spoons. The handle is nice and chunky for little hands to hold. And the shape is perfect - big enough to hold things like cereal, but small enough to fit into little mouths.
customer_reviews.author: MOMaholic

customer_reviews.title: I love the shape and size of the spoons
customer_reviews.text: I love the shape and size of the spoons, making easy for my 2 toddlers to use them. My year old is learning and they are perfect for his size, my 2 and a half boy is an expert. I love the bright colors. Already bought the forks and are working very well.
customer_reviews.author: Aradan

customer_reviews.title: Bigger spoon
customer_reviews.text: Definitely for a toddler because of the size in my opinion. My 18 month old likes the shorter handle because it is easier for him to hold. Easy to clean, just put it in the dishwasher
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 1 yr old grandson. Mom says they are his favorite spoons. Easier for him to get near his mouth with food!
customer_reviews.author: grams2ten

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Had the forks like them and wanted the spoons for my son to use instead of the plastic ones. He loves them. They are easy to clean and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Mills

customer_reviews.title: BEST TODDLER SPOONS
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my toddler to learn to eat with and so far so good they are easy to hold and not too big or too long for him
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size For Toddlers!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought two packs of the spoons and forks for our 17 month old son. We noticed a difference right away with how he uses them compared to others. They have a non slip coating with texture that helps him grip better. The tips are stainless steel and very smooth. There perfect for his size.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Wicks

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I still have these. They look new. Didn't realize they were bought in 2014... 6 years ago!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: We use these every day.
customer_reviews.text: We use these every day and my child is very proficient with spoons and forks ahead of his milestones.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Nitschke

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for my toddler’s hands and are breeze to clean in the dishwasher!
customer_reviews.author: Ivy's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Works for us
customer_reviews.text: Nice weight. Good transition to normal spoons. Much loved by my kiddos. Labelled them with a Sharpie and they stay legible for ~10 trips through the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Charli

customer_reviews.title: A great next step!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these spoons. They were a great next step for him after the big round handled spoons we had and I like the shape of the spoon part itself. He also now has access to choose his own silverware for each meal and almost always chooses these spoons over anything else. (And the fact that he loves the color green helps, too!)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the thicker and smaller handle for easy handling
customer_reviews.text: Love the thicker and smaller handle for easy handling. But the scoop part fits way too much food on spoon. My child has a hard time being able to put spoon in her mouth due to the size of spoon. It makes more of a mess and she gets frustrated that she cannot eat. Great design just make the spoon part smaller please!
customer_reviews.author: Pologirl846

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Small Hands
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these spoons as a complement to the forks from Gerber. They are sturdy and well-made and perfect for small hands. My almost 3 year old has no issues gripping or using these spoons. I also appreciate that the spoon itself is a good size without being too large. We have a lot of spoons that are super tiny and therefore almost useless in scooping up yogurt or applesauce. These are just right in size for my preschooler.
customer_reviews.author: R. Austin

customer_reviews.title: A Hit!
customer_reviews.text: Our granddaughter almost 2 years is loving her new cutlery and is learning to feed herself. Just the right size and does well in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Wintin

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: These spoons replaced some OXOs. The size is perfect for toddlers (OXOs are deeper but too wide as well) and they rest on the table without the metal parts touching the table, so that it stays clean. Colors are pleasant and make finding them in drawer easy.
customer_reviews.author: Ye Li

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Great for my 22 month old twin girls.
customer_reviews.author: Joe The Electrician

customer_reviews.title: Great spoons, the forks are good too!
customer_reviews.text: These are great first spoons for a child just starting out. The large handles make them easier to hold and position properly. We purchased the forks elsewhere and they work great too. I really like that they are metal like real flatware.
customer_reviews.author: Shana

customer_reviews.title: They're easy for him to hold and use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these spoons for my one year old son and he likes them a lot. They're easy for him to hold and use. The metal spoon is wide and deep enough to hold a good amount of liquid, but still narrow and shallow enough to fit in my baby's mouth.They are exactly what I was looking for, and I would definitely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Tikki

customer_reviews.title: Made for Tiny Hands
customer_reviews.text: Colorful spoons that are dishwasher safe and just the right size for small toddler hands.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great for feeding themselves
customer_reviews.text: These baby spoons are bigger, so they are probably best for a baby who is at least 9 months old. But my baby got these at 12 months old and took to them very easily. The handles are rubbery and have a good grip for when he is really messy and the spoon is covered in baby food. He can now feed himself. I like that the end of the spoon is metal so it gets him used to using normal spoons.
customer_reviews.author: MR J

customer_reviews.title: pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Durable and perfect size; however, they're a bit large for my son who is a year and a half. I purchased hoping he could start using them, because he's interested in feeding himself, but the metal portion is so wide it doesn't fit in his mouth well. I know we will grow into them, though!
customer_reviews.author: Critical Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great for teaching toddlers to use utensils
customer_reviews.text: My all time favorite type of toddler silverware. These are great transition pieces to teach a toddler to hold utensils and utilize them. They are dishwasher safe too. We have them in spoons and forks.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Cacace

customer_reviews.title: My kids approve
customer_reviews.text: Can never find these at my local stores. My kids love these. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A.

customer_reviews.title: easy to hold, high quality
customer_reviews.text: last long, easy to hold, used from sister to brother for years
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Best toddler utensils
customer_reviews.text: We love these spoons and the matching forks. They are perfect for little hands. We have used them since he turned a year and he still loves them at nearly 3. Many rounds in the dishwasher and they are still perfect.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hallier

customer_reviews.title: Great for little hands!
customer_reviews.text: I already owned a set of these in blue and needed more to use throughout the week now that we are home more than usual due to quarantine. Same great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Spoons very flat
customer_reviews.text: Love the gerbers forks but these spoons are flat so kinf of defeat the purpose and make it harder for my son to use them with yogurt etc. I wouldn't repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wednesday lopez

customer_reviews.title: No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: I gave them to my daughter. She used them with no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel, H

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Good enough for the baby mouth but its a little short when you use them to fit the kids but I think it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised, but like them anyhow!
customer_reviews.text: We love these spoons but ours did not have the advertised spoon rest. We contacted Amazon who sent us another set which also didn't have the spoon rest. Despite this, we do really like the spoons and they work great for our 3 year old. The spoon is actually big enough to hold food on it and they are well made. These last much longer than the character utensils you find in stores.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: no good
customer_reviews.text: These "spoons" are: a. flat b. way too wide for a baby's mouth
customer_reviews.author: Amy Robinson Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Great first spoon.
customer_reviews.text: These work really well for our 6 month old. At times she is more interested in using the rubber handle as a teether, but that's ok! The size is great for little hands and she can manipulate it well. I really like the design with the "stand" on the back of the spoon so it doesn't touch the surface when placed down.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: Needed these for my two year old and they're perfect. Very cute and easy for him to use.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian M De La Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little hands
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these utensils. I had previously purchased them at Target but stopped seeing them there. Amazon sells then for roughly the same price, so I was happy to see that. They are easy to use, clean and small grips for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler utensils
customer_reviews.text: Great and easy for my son to use. The small plastic ones got to be too small and light as he got bigger. These are perfect. I think he started using them around ?18months...he does have a fascination with using utensils lol. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I prefer metal over plastic and these are very easy for little ones to hold. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Spatulas, not spoons
customer_reviews.text: These spoons are WAY too flat! They're more like spatulas, not spoons. I've never seen such flat spoons before, either for kids or for adults. They can't hold anything. Especially runnier foods, like yogurt - forget it. They're also very wide and my 21-month-old looks awkward trying to fit them into her mouth. I really don't like them. What a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Great for our 2-year old
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to hold and use, and it's easy to clean. Perfect for lots of use. We got the forks as well, and they are just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic silverware for Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set as a Christmas gift for my niece. I used this kind for my own kids and they are still in fantastic shape after 4 years of constant use. The handle is a very good size for toddler hands, is easy to control, and is a good length too. It is somewhat soft, soft enough to bite and make a mark. The 'bowl' of the spoon holds a good amount of food for a toddler's mouth. I would highly recommend this type of silverware for toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Martin

product_meta.title: First Essentials by NUK Kiddy Cutlery Spoon Set, color may vary, 3pk
feature_bullets: Rest Easy support keeps germs off utensils and mess off table
Soft handles sized just right for toddler hands
